cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi WNW of Nassau, Bahamas and 180 mi SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the north-western Bahamas, then turning north-northwest skirting the Florida east coast and continuing toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or along the Florida east coast close to Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Virginia Key through Deerfield Beach, extending northward to South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions likely; 34-kt wind probability 94% and 50-kt 63%, with a 31% chance of 64-kt winds. Onset late Thu afternoon, peak early Fri morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible along the Broward County coast including Port Everglades if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, leading to urban/terminal flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal flooding, possible power outages and debris affecting access roads and terminal operations.
